Are the following statements True or False?

True / False The Romans called the land of the Jews Judea, today this land is called Israël.

True / False Judaism is one of the oldest monotheistic religions, they believe in multiple gods.

True / False The sacred text of the Jews is called the Tenach, which was written down around 500 BC.

True / False The Jewish religion was privileged, none of the empires who conquered forced the religion to change their beliefs.

True / False Jews did not have to obey the Roman emperor.

True / False Jews did not have to worship the Roman emperor as a living god.

Complete the text with help of the study-book.

The only temple of the Jews was in , but nobody was allowed to enter it. Only the , the experts of the holy texts of Judaism, could go in. And despite the Roman rule, which started in 63 BC, they were still permitted to keep their own faith. The Romans didn't even conquered , but the Holy Land became a . That means the Jews could still govern themselves, but still had to obey Rome. The men who was ruling was , but he became a and killed a lot of people and even babies. The Roman couldn't trust this mad man anymore and decided to split up Judea, but it remained under control of the Roman governor . In these confusing times Jewish walked the land and were preaching. One of them laid the foundation of a complete new religion.

prompt.body: Use the wordlist and the study-book page 89 and 94. Match the descriptions with the right words.

content.body: Jewish prophet, said people should take care of each otherand that after this life there was a new life in heaven.
Method of punishment in which the victim is nailed at a cross
A person who is, according to others, in contact with god(s). Most of the time theu preach their divine message.
Small group of active members (for example christians) who do not follow popular beliefs (like judaism).

Fill in the gaps:

Jesus of Nazareth was a Jewish who taught the Israelians about his beliefs. According to some people Jesus even had royal blood as a descendent of and if Jesus would unite the Jews they could expell the Romans. Only a few persons truely believed that he was actually the , but this belief was dangerous for the position of the . Nevertheless, this small group continued to pass on his teachings after the of Jesus. They told everyone that Jesus' suffering at the cross freed men from their . Therefore followers of Jesus called him or Messiah, which means the 'annointed one', or the 'savior' of all. Perhaps more important is, as long as we truely believe in God, that the sacrifice of Jesus allows us to go to after our death. And because God does not dsicriminate there is a place for all faithful believers. Young and old, man or woman, rich or poor, everyone will be welcomed.
